input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Modernization of the E-Logbook System Resulting from the Amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the Implementing Regulation Assigned to It.. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the implementing regulation assigned to it. EU Member States are obliged to establish and operate monitoring centers fisheries, whose main task is to monitor fishing activities and implement appropriate control systems enabling proper supervision of the proper conduct of fishing. The fisheries administration uses many programs enabling the implementation of the above-mentioned purposes, but the key is the electronic fishing log software "e-logbook system". above the system contains all data regarding the register of fishing vessels, catch records, data validation, and allocations fishing quotas, register of violations, etc. Modernization of the system includes the costs of development work, introducing required software modifications, and introducing changes to the computer program after its launch in the customer's environment. Most often it has a purpose changing its operational, system and performance features. 2. The subject of the order will be completed within 2,035 man-hours. Modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the assigned implementing regulation. 1. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: OSTROWIEC ŚWIĘTOKRZYSKI COMMUNE. Summary: Purchase of a 9-Seater Passenger Car, Adapted to Transport People with Disabilities, for the Needs of the Social Services Center in Ostrowiec Świętokrzyski. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery of a brand new passenger car, designed to transport a maximum of 9 people (8 people + 1 driver), adapted to transport people with disabilities (in wheelchairs), elderly people, people in crisis of homelessness and people from rural areas. covered by difficult communication access, carried out by the Social Services Center in Ostrowiec witokrzyski. The car being the subject of the order will be equipped with additional equipment in the form of a lift for loading a person in a wheelchair, mounting rails and additional handles for a passenger enabling the transportation of a person in a wheelchair.. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: TOMASZÓW COUNTY. Summary: Delivery of Equipment for Tomaszów County as Part of the "Cybersecure Local Government" Project, Divided into Parts. Description: 1. Part 1 of the order Purchase of a backup server as part of the project entitled Cybersecure local government: 1) The subject of the order is the delivery, installation and configuration of a modern data backup server - 1 piece, implemented in the form of a hardware appliance. The system must meet the requirements for high efficiency, reliability and security of stored data. The ordering party expects that the solution will enable management and backup copies at the level of disks, files and folders, and also support for virtual machines and UEFI/GPT-based systems. The system should offer the functionality of data replication to multiple locations, support for deduplication and compression mechanisms, as well as cooperation with volume shadow copy services (VSS). It is crucial ensuring business continuity and eliminating single points of failure, as well as the availability of service in the Polish language version. Additionally, the system must have monitoring mechanisms, automatic notification of task status and the possibility of integration with various IT environments, and also ensures scalability as the amount of data and devices to be protected increases.2) The contractor is.... Description: The subject of the order is: "Accelerating the processes of digital transformation of health care through further development of digital services at the Gabriel Narutowicz Municipal Specialist Hospital in Krakow-II." The order was divided into 3 parts: Part I concerns expansion or purchase of a hospital information system (HIS), part II concerns the implementation of an IT system for digitizing paper documentation, including at least an information card on hospital treatment along with the purchase of equipment (scanner) in integration with the existing hospital system (HIS), part III concerns the expansion of existing hospital systems (HIS, RIS/PACS) with functionality enabling integration and data exchange with the intelligent services platform (PUI) in the field of AI, supporting the process of making diagnostic and treatment decisions by a doctor. The proceedings are financed under the National Reconstruction and Resilience Plan, Component D "Efficiency, accessibility and quality of the health care system" Investment D1.1.2 "Accelerating digital transformation processes in health care through further development of digital services in health care." The scope of the order under the option right (12 months 200,000 donations) includes: Delivery of reagents to simultaneous detection of genetic material of HIV RNA viruses, HCV RNA, HBV DNA in plasma pools (taking into account incomplete pools) and in single samples, together with the required controls/calibrators, archiving of the tested material, all materials consumables and operational items necessary to support the above-mentioned research and the lease of the necessary equipment (basic system and backup system) for automatic research using molecular biology methods and the control system and connection to the system the Ordering Party's IT system and the e-Krew system. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: 3RD REGIONAL LOGISTICS BASE, FACULTY OF AVIATION TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Delivery of the P70Ta000A03-801 Engine Starter for M-346 Aircraft. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the supply of aircraft ground support equipment (NOSP) - 1 piece of the P70TA000A03-801 engine starter for M-346 aircraft, hereinafter also referred to as the "product". 2. The delivered product must be new, from current production, i.e. from the year delivery or the year preceding delivery, must be complete and technically efficient and must meet the quality requirements of the standards and requirements included in the manufacturer's current technical documentation in force on the date of signing the contract. 3. Together with the product The contractor will provide the technical documentation referred to in § 8 of the draft provisions of the contract constituting Annex No. 1 to the SWZ. The Contractor will grant an indefinite license for the provided technical documentation with a notice period of not less than 25 years, within the scope and in the fields of use specified in § 8 of the Draft Provisions of the Agreement. 4. The ordering party described the subject of the order by indicating the origin (manufacturer and type of engine starter) without the possibility of admitting products equivalent to reason: - the device is dedicated to starting the engine of the M-346 aircraft and is included in the technical documentation of the above-mentioned aircraft; - the technical documentation of the M-346 aircraft does not provide for the use of an engine starter other than the one indicated in proceedings; - the use of a replacement engine starter for the M-346 aircraft that has not been approved by the manufacturer may pose a threat to the life or health of persons involved in the operation of the above-mentioned aircraft. aircraft.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Purchase and Delivery of Medical Equipment as Part of the Project Entitled "Equipping the Provincial Hospital in Kielce with Medical Equipment for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Patients with Oncological Diseases" For.... Description: Purchase and delivery of medical equipment as part of the project entitled "Equipping the Provincial Hospital in Kielce with medical equipment for the diagnosis and treatment of patients with oncological diseases" for... Purchase and delivery of medical equipment as part of the project entitled "Equipping the Provincial Hospital in Kielce with medical equipment for the diagnosis and treatment of patients with oncological diseases" for the needs of the Operating Theater and the Diagnostic Imaging Department The subject of the order is the purchase and delivery of equipment medical as part of the implementation of the project entitled "Equipment of the Provincial Hospital in Kielce with medical equipment for the diagnosis and treatment of patients with oncological diseases" for the needs of the Operating Theater and the Diagnostic Imaging Department i.e.: Operating table - 1 set, Set of surgical tools - 3 sets, Ultrasound - 5 sets. The subject of the order must meet the requirements of the principle "Do No Serious Harm" (DNSH - Do No Significant Harm), in accordance with Art. 17 of Regulation (EU) 2020/852 of 18 June 2020. This rule applies in connection with the financing of the order under the National Recovery and Resilience Plan (KPO). The DNSH principle means that at no stage of order execution - from production, through delivery, use, and eventual disposal - there must be no serious harm to the EU's environmental goals, i.e.: Mitigation of climate change, Adaptation to climate change, Sustainable management of water and marine resources, Circular economy (Circular Economy), Prevention pollution and their control, protection of biodiversity and ecosystems. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MULTI-SPECIALTY PROVINCIAL HOSPITAL IN GORZÓW WIELKOPOLSKI. LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY. Summary: Delivery of Reagents and Consumables Along with the Lease of Analyzers for Pcr Rt Tests. Description: The subject of the order includes the supply of reagents and consumables along with the lease of PCR RT analyzers, in particular: - successive delivery of the assortment specified in the order documents, - leasing of analyzers and the required equipment accompanying equipment specified in the procurement documents. Package No. 1 As part of the subject of the order, the contractor will ensure the successive delivery of the assortment specified in the order documents: delivery of reagents and consumables along with the lease analyzer for urgent PCR RT tests in a modular system. Package No. 2 As part of the subject of the order, the Contractor will ensure the successive delivery of the assortment specified in the order documents: delivery of consumables and reagents to the Medical Diagnostic Laboratory with the lease of an analyzer for quick detection of infections using the RT-PCR method. Package No. 3 As part of the subject of the order, the contractor will ensure the successive delivery of the assortment specified in the order documents: delivery of materials consumables and reagents for the Microbiology Laboratory along with the lease of an analyzer for simultaneous detection of many parameters from the primary sample using the PCR method. Doc Title: Delivery of reagents and consumables along with the lease of PCR analyzers RT Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Scope of the order includes in particular: making PCBs from FR4 material with Tg parameters ≥ 155 °C, based on the provided Gerber files, full electrical test of the made boards, purchase of all electronic components in accordance with the BOM list, assembly. machine SMD according to the provided documentation, soldering using "no-clean" technology or with ultrasonic cleaning, depanelization by cutting out and individual packaging of each board, delivery of complete FEB systems. As part of the order fulfillment The contractor is obliged to produce a trial batch (200 pieces) within 30 days from the date of signing the contract and deliver the entire order within 4 months from signing the contract. All items must be new, free from defects in materials and materials legal regulations, made in accordance with technical standards and delivered with the required documentation in Polish or English. The minimum warranty period is 12 months. The contractor ensures transport and collection of the devices during the warranty period on his own cost if repair is not possible at the Ordering Party's premises. output.Description: The subject of the order is the manufacture and delivery of 11,800 pieces of FEB controller systems (HK-FEB-6V1) intended for the multi-PMT modules of the long-range detector of the Hyper-Kamiokande experiment, in accordance with the design documentation HK-FEB-6V1-Gerber.zip. Scope of the order includes in particular: making PCBs from FR4 material with Tg parameters ≥ 155 °C, based on the provided Gerber files, full electrical test of the made boards, purchase of all electronic components in accordance with the BOM list, assembly. machine SMD according to the provided documentation, soldering using "no-clean" technology or with ultrasonic cleaning, depanelization by cutting out and individual packaging of each board, delivery of complete FEB systems. As part of the order fulfillment The contractor is obliged to produce a trial batch (200 pieces) within 30 days from the date of signing the contract and deliver the entire order within 4 months from signing the contract. All items must be new, free from defects in materials and materials legal regulations, made in accordance with technical standards and delivered with the required documentation in Polish or English. The minimum warranty period is 12 months. The contractor ensures transport and collection of the devices during the warranty period on his own cost if repair is not possible at the Ordering Party's premises. Delivery is made to the Ordering Party's address in accordance with INCOTERMS 2020 - DDP, with full insurance on the part of the Contractor. Detailed...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY CLINICAL CENTER. Summary: 368/Pn/2025 - Delivery of Medicinal Products for Uck. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the supply of medicinal products for UCK in the assortment, estimated quantity and requirements specified in Annex 3 to the SWZ. 2. The Ordering Party allows the submission of partial offers. The term partial offer means: individual items set out in Annex 3 to the SWZ. The contractor may submit an offer for one or more items. 3. As part of the items marked in the assortment and price form with the symbol (**) in Annex No. 3 to the SWZ, the Ordering Party requires that the offered the preparation was included in the catalog of reimbursed drugs used in chemotherapy/Catalogue of reimbursed drugs used in drug programs. 4. The ordering party specified the packaging method in the assortment and price form. In positions where there is none such description, the Contractor may offer any packaging method while maintaining the quantity required by the Ordering Party specified in a given item. The contractor must price the proposed packaging method with appropriate calculations. 5. Deliveries will occur successively, in quantity and assortment, in accordance with the Ordering Party's partial orders within 2 days from the date of placing the order, and "cito" delivery within 12 hours from placing the order. The Contractor will be obliged to deliver the ordered assortment to: at your own expense to the Hospital Pharmacy. 6. The Ordering Party requires that the prices of the offered medicines are no higher than the official prices specified in Art. 9 section 1 and 2 of the Act of May 12, 2011 on the reimbursement of medicines and foodstuffs.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Digitization of medical documentation important from the point of view of treatment and prevention, 3. Actions to increase the level of security, 4.Implementation of AI solutions, 5. Warranty for the subject of the order, 6. Warranty and service conditions not inferior on the warranty and service conditions of the manufacturer of the offered subject of the order, 7. Any indication of the manufacturer's name by the Ordering Party is intended to determine the functionality class, purpose of the subject of the order and is intended to establish a standard, they do not indicate but for a specific product or a specific manufacturer, 8.All equipment supplied must be brand new and not previously used in any projects, manufactured no more than 6 months prior to delivery and unused prior to the date of delivery with excluding use necessary to test their correct operation. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL IN KRAKOW. Summary: Dfp.271.282.2025.Ls - Delivery of Reagents, Consumables and Control Materials for the Department of Hematological Diagnostics and Genetics at the University Hospital in Krakow.. Description: The subject of the order is the supply of reagents, consumables and control materials for the Department of Hematological Diagnostics and Genetics at the University Hospital in Krakow. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in the SWZ together with the annexes. This description should be read together with any changes to the content of the SWZ, e.g. resulting from responses to contractors' inquiries. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Maritime Analysis Tool. Description: The subject of the contract is a maritime analysis tool to support Frontex-s maritime analysis function by providing capabilities to analyse and derive insights out of ‘big maritime data-. The maritime analytics implies the competent use of the system to support the development and implementation of risk profiles as well as to identify and monitor areas used as embarkation or transit points for irregular migration and cross-border crime. The maritime analytics system should provide a user-friendly interface and include the integration and fusion of data/information from an increased number of sources. In addition, it is requested to enable customized search rules and queries based on specific ship behaviours. The detailed Terms of Reference (ToR) are included in Annex-I. According to the Maritime Analysis Tool ToR (see Annex-I), the ‘usability requirements- are listed as the following functionalities from the risk analysis perspective that the Maritime Analysis Tool should provide to Frontex analysts: a.to capture, store and manage global maritime big data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. b.to fuse and integrate maritime -big data- with vessels- historical data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. c.To allow the export of the query results with the highest available limit - at least 10.000 entries. <br> Doc Title: Maritime analysis tool <br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)
output.Summary: Maritime Analysis Tool

The maritime analytics system should provide a user-friendly interface and include the integration and fusion of data/information from an increased number of sources. In addition, it is requested to enable customized search rules and queries based on specific ship behaviours. The detailed Terms of Reference (ToR) are included in Annex-I. According to the Maritime Analysis Tool ToR (see Annex-I), the ‘usability requirements- are listed as the following functionalities from the risk analysis perspective that the Maritime Analysis Tool should provide to Frontex analysts: a.to capture, store and manage global maritime big data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. b.to fuse and integrate maritime -big data- with vessels- historical data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. c.To allow the export of the query results with the highest available limit - at least 10.000 entries. <br> Doc Title: Maritime analysis tool <br> Contract Type: supplies

The Ordering Party does not require the funds in question to be submitted with the offer evidence. 6. The Ordering Party does not allow the submission of variant offers. 7. The Ordering Party allows the execution of part of the order to be entrusted to a Subcontractor. 8. The Ordering Party requests that the Contractor indicate in his offer the parts of the order whose performance he will entrust Subcontractors, and providing the names of any Subcontractors, if they are already known. 9. Deadline for order completion (delivery) for each task: up to 16 business days, counting from the date of acceptance of the demand referred to in Chapter. XIX § 3 section 2. 10. Janikowo, consisting in the delivery and installation of 5 machines for waste segregation. The location at specific points in the Wilkoński estate in Janikowo is intended to facilitate access and convenience for residents to dispose of sorted waste, and thus thus encouraging them even more to care for the environment. The scope of the order also includes the construction of a composting plant for biodegradable green waste and a reloading point for separated waste, delivery and installation of a truck scale with a container. office space and construction works consisting in hardening the area in accordance with the design documentation and bill of quantities. These documents (design documentation and bill of quantities) complement each other. The bill of quantities provided applies only to works related to construction of a composting plant. The hardening of the area in the bill of quantities does not take into account the hardening of the area for waste disposal machines. The delivery and installation of machines should be priced based on the description of the subject of the order. Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the area Janikowo commune Doc Title: Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the Janikowo Commune Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SOCIAL SERVICES CENTER IN KOSZALIN. Summary: Rehabilitation Equipment Rental - Part And. Description: The subject of the order is the comprehensive implementation of the service Task 1: Rental of rehabilitation equipment in the form of wheelchairs. The scope of the service includes: 1) equipment rental for a period of up to 6 months, 2) equipment delivery (delivery of equipment by the Contractor to place of residence of the Recipient indicated in the Service Order Card),3) installation of equipment (if the situation requires it, the Contractor installs the equipment at the Recipient's place of residence),4) learning how to use the equipment (providing the Recipient with the necessary information and operating instructions to use the rehabilitation equipment), 5) collection of the rehabilitation equipment (after the end of the rental period, the Contractor collects the equipment from the Recipient's place of residence, the collection date is the last day of renting the equipment indicated in the Service Order Card), 6) technical inspection and maintenance between rentals, servicing of the equipment while in use by the Recipient), 7) cleaning and disinfection of the equipment after each receipt. A detailed description of the subject of the order can be found in Appendix No. 6a to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The subject of the order is: "Manufacture and delivery of two sets of boats and their retrieval system for the needs of the MGW in Zabrze", which are a component of the transport system on the waterway located in the workings of the Main Key Heritage Adit. Within In order to complete the above task, two sets of boats must be made, delivered and launched, consisting of two boats connected together, made on the basis of a design owned by the Ordering Party, approved by the Polish Register of Shipping S.A. constituting Attachment No. 1 to the description of the subject of the order, including the delivery and installation of the boat recovery system in the designated location in accordance with the project constituting Attachment No. 2. As part of the implementation of the above task, all costs should also be calculated materials necessary to complete the electrical installation to power the battery charging system located on board the boats in question and the boat steering system in the port. Summary: Delivery of Self-Propelled Platforms Mounted on Truck Chassis and Tracked Chassis for the Needs of Tauron Dystrybucja S.A. Branch in Krakow.. Description: The subject of the Order is the supply of self-propelled platforms mounted on truck chassis and tracked chassis for the needs of TAURON Dystrybucja S.A. Branch in Krakow. The order was divided into 4 parts. Detailed Description The subject of the order are Annexes No. 10a-10d to the SWZ Delivery of platforms - part 1 Delivery of self-propelled platforms with a telescopic boom or telescopic boom with a JIB arm with a working height of min. 20 m, mounted on a truck chassis with 4x4 drive with a gross vehicle weight of approx. 11 t - 4 pieces Platform delivery - part 2 Delivery of a self-propelled platform with a telescopic boom or a telescopic boom with a JiB arm with a working height of min. 19 m, mounted on the chassis of a 4x4 truck with a GVW of 5.5 - 7 t - 1 piece Platform delivery - part 3 Delivery of self-propelled platforms with a boom articulated and telescopic with a working height of min. 14 m, mounted on the chassis of a 4x4 truck with a GVW of 3.5 t - 2 pieces; Platform delivery - part 4 Delivery self-propelled platform with a telescopic-articulated or telescopic-articulated boom with a JIB arm with a working height of min. 16 m, mounted on a tracked chassis - 1 piece Doc Title: Delivery of self-propelled platforms mounted on chassis trucks and tracked chassis for the needs of TAURON Dystrybucja S.A. Branch in Krakow. Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: Sales with delivery, assembly and commissioning of a transmission electron microscope from the unit. control unit with the possibility of expansion with equipment for cryoimaging and X-ray microanalysis. The subject of the order is described in Annex A to the SWZ - Description of the subject orders. The Contractor will deliver and install the subject of the order at his own expense and risk in the place specified by the Ordering Party. Domestic and foreign transport with insurance, all customs duties, stamp duties and all other fees - on the side Contractors. The contractor will provide a warranty for the subject of the order - min. 12 months from the date of signing the acceptance protocol without any reservations. During the warranty period, the contractor undertakes to ensure the continuous operation of the device: - Service response time - 48 hours from the moment of reporting the failure; - Repair time - up to 14 days from the moment of reporting the failure, up to 30 days if it is necessary to import parts from abroad; - The warranty period will be automatically extended for individual elements of the subject matter of the contract extension of the repair time. The Ordering Party allows the submission of equivalent offers. The contractor may offer equipment with the same or better technical, qualitative and functional parameters, meeting the minimum specified parameters by the Ordering Party in Annex A to the SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: LEGNICA MUNICIPALITY REPRESENTED BY THE MAYOR OF LEGNICA. Summary: "Purchase of Buses for Transporting Disabled People" - 3 Parts Repeat. Description: The subject of this order is: Purchase and delivery of brand new complete bus vehicles, i.e. base vehicles - along with the production of all equipment and bodywork elements, constituting one complete vehicle intended for transporting children and young people with mobility disabilities and a minibus for transporting people with disabilities - the order is divided into three parts, adapted to transport people with disabilities: Lot No. 1: 3 buses with internal lift adapted for transport children and adolescents with physical disabilities; Lot No. 2: 3 buses with an internal ramp adapted to transport children and teenagers with physical disabilities; Lot No. 3: 1 minibus adapted to transport children and adolescents with disabilities motor 2. General requirements 1. The Ordering Party allows only brand new vehicles. A vehicle is considered brand new: not used, unregistered, not used for test drives, presentations or research, produced no earlier than 1 year 2025. 2.Vehicles must: be free from physical and legal defects, meet the requirements of the Road Traffic Law and implementing acts, have a current approval and admission to traffic in the territory of the Republic of Poland. 3. Requirements for development vehicle 1. The Ordering Party requires that the construction of the base vehicle, including interior adaptation and installation of devices for transporting people with disabilities, be carried out: by vehicle manufacturer.... The Ordering Party allows in accordance with Art. 91 section 1 of the Public Procurement Law folding partial offers. An offer may be submitted for one or two lots. The Ordering Party does not limit the number of parts of the contract for which an order may be awarded to one Contractor. Offers in each part of the order will be examined and assessed separately, i.e.: 1) Part A - delivery of 4 command and communication cars (company command posts), 2) Part B - delivery of 3 command and communication cars (company command posts). 3) Part C - delivery of 2 cars command and communications (company command posts). A detailed description and method of implementing individual parts of the order is included in the OPZ, i.e.: 1) for part A of the order in Annex No. 3A to the SWZ, 2) for part B of the order in Annex No. 3B to SWZ, 3) for part C of the order in Annex No. 3c to the SWZ. The Ordering Party envisages the use of the so-called reverse procedure referred to in Art. 139 section 1 of the Public Procurement Law, i.e. the Ordering Party will first examine and evaluate the offers, and then qualify them subjective evaluation of the Contractor whose offer was rated the highest, in terms of the lack of grounds for exclusion and the fulfillment of the conditions for participation in the proceedings. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: INSTITUTE OF MOTHER AND CHILD. Summary: Purchase of Newborn Screening Kits for Severe Congenital Immunodeficiencies and Spinal Muscle Atrophy (Scid/Sma). Description: PURCHASE OF NEWBORN SCREENING KITS FOR SEVERE CONGENITAL IMMUNODEFICIENCIES AND SPINAL MUSCLE Atrophy (SCID/SMA) 1. Reagent kits for newborn screening for spinal muscular atrophy and congenital deficiencies immunity, including SCID and hypogammglobulinemia, in the number of 362,880 determinations on microplates containing 96 wells each. The kits are based on real-time quantitative PCR and enable simultaneous assessment of the presence of homozygous exon deletion. 7 of the SMN1 gene and quantification of the number of TREC and KREC molecules. The kits must contain: appropriate controls and a set of samples enabling the generation of a curve for the quantification of the number of TREC and KREC molecules; reagents and plates necessary for DNA isolation for testing purposes; reagents containing polymerase and oligonucleotides enabling the identification of exon 7 of the SMN1, TREC gene and KREC and the reference gene. 2. When selecting the most advantageous offer, the Ordering Party reserves the right to: possibility of reducing the purchase of reagents, but not more than by 20% of the above-mentioned the subject of the order, in the event of exceeding the amount allocated for the execution of the order or objective and justified circumstances, in particular reduction expected number of births and tests.. 3. The Contractor is obliged to deliver sets packed with 96 markings or more - in multiples of 96 markings (1 plate). 4. Pursuant to Art. 257 of the Public Procurement Law. Order.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The Subject of the Order includes the delivery of parts indicated in the "List of ordered parts", constituting Annex No. 1 to the Specification Technical (hereinafter: "ST"), constituting Annex No. 1 to the SWZ and being its integral part. 3. The Ordering Party requires the execution of the Subject of the Order in batches according to the delivery schedule included in Annex No. 1 to the ST in the quantities of individual parts indicated in Annex No. 1 to the ST. Within a given batch indicated in the above-mentioned schedule, the Ordering Party does not allow partial deliveries. The entirety of a given batch indicated in the above-mentioned schedule for a given Task must be performed as part of one delivery. 4. Subject The order will be fulfilled in accordance with the procedure documentation, i.e. SWZ and its annexes, in particular ST and the contract template (Appendix No. 2 to SWZ). 5. Whereas: 1) The Ordering Party purchased Inspiro metro vehicles without a license for their production (ex due to the costs of such proceedings), and therefore has not received and does not have construction and production documentation of vehicles or their parts; 2) use of parts other than those indicated in the ST attached to the SWZ, for which the procedure was not carried out modernization of vehicles described on the website of the Office of Rail Transport would violate the documents on the basis of which type tests of vehicles were carried out, which were the basis for admitting them to service.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: "Preparation and Delivery of Educational Packages for Conducting Classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the Bof Area "Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in Preschool.... Description: "Preparation and delivery of educational packages for conducting classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the BOF area "Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in Preschool... is to prepare and deliver 1,460 packages educational activities for children aged 5-6 years, carried out in 115 Preschool Education Centers (OWP) from 12 communes of the Białystok Functional Area (OWP) according to Annex No. 1 to OPZ. As part of the service, the Contractor will provide: (A) materials educational: art, office and toys; (B) graphic design and printing of materials, and (C) packaging of educational materials and printouts into "educational packages" and their delivery to the 115th OWP. Educational packages will serve OWP teachers until conducting 4 cycles of classes (so-called Bofka missions), one mission in each of the 4 competence groups: (1) language and culture, (2) modern technologies, (3) healthy development, (4) entrepreneurship - 8 classes in each mission (Cultural Mission, Technological Mission, Mission Ecological and Business Mission) - a total of 32 classes. Summary: Ips Software to Detect and Block Attacks, Ids Software to Detect Intrusions, Monitor Network Traffic, Analyze and Search for Known Threats, Suspicious Activities or Anomalies.... Description: IPS software to detect and block attacks, IDS software to detect intrusions, monitor network traffic, analyze and search for known threats, suspicious activities or anomalies... IPS software to detect and block attacks, IDS software for detecting intrusions, monitoring network traffic, analyzing and searching for known threats, suspicious activities or anomalies, post-intrusion analysis software and a central password manager with a support service technical. The subject of the order was divided into four parts: 1)Part I - Purchase and implementation of IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) software 2)Part II - Purchase and implementation of IDS (Intrusion Detection System) software 3)Part III - Purchase and implementation post-intrusion analysis software 4)Part IV - Purchase and implementation of central password manager software. A detailed description of the subject of the order and the method of implementation was specified in the Draft Provisions of the Agreement (Annex No. 2a to the SWZ - for Part I, Annex No. 2b to the SWZ - for Part II, Annex No. 2c to the SWZ - for Part III, Annex No. 2d to the SWZ - for Part IV), Description of the subject of the order (Annex No. 1 to the SWZ). Part III - Purchase and implementation of analysis software post-burglary. Doc Title: IPS software to detect and block attacks, IDS software to detect intrusions, monitor network traffic, analyze and search for known threats, suspicious activity or anomalies, analysis software post-burglary protection and a central password manager with technical support services. Summary: "Framework Agreement for the Supply of an it Solution Including Siem/Soar Information and Security Event Management Functionality and the Provision of other Accompanying Services". Description: 1. The subject of the proceedings is the conclusion of a Framework Agreement for the selection of a Contractor who will provide the Units with an IT solution, hereinafter referred to as the "System", including: a) a solution for managing security events and information (SIEM class system - Security Information and Event Management), hereinafter referred to as the "SIEM System" and b) a solution for the automation and structuring of processes in IT systems (SOAR class system - Security Orchestration, Automation And Response), hereinafter referred to as the "SOAR System", together with technical support, Warranty and Accompanying Services in the maximum total quantity indicated in the OPZ, to be used throughout the duration of the Framework Agreement, including the Contractor's Services (Installation and Implementation with training workshops on the implemented System, Contractor's Expert Support) and Manufacturer's Training Services. 2. The Ordering Party provides for the possibility of implementing the System in various locations, configurations and at various times deliveries during the term of the Framework Agreement, in accordance with the order applications submitted by the Entities. 3. The Ordering Party requires that the implementation of the System be possible as independent instances and without any limitation as to the number of these instances. However The Ordering Party requires that the use of the System be possible in at least two independent license groups, i.e. one group for the Ministry of Justice, with the possibility of using the System by judicial units within.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KOLUSZKI COMMUNE. Summary: Collection and Management of Municipal Waste from Property Owners Living in the Koluszki Commune. Description: The subject of the contract is the provision of services consisting in the collection and management of separately collected municipal waste and mixed waste from real estate where residents live and from real estate where there are: cottages holiday homes or other properties used for recreational purposes, used only for part of the year. Approximate amounts of individual types of waste are included in the unit price form constituting Annex 2 to the Specification Order Terms. The total estimated amount of waste is: 19,010 Mg. The detailed scope of the order includes: 1) Collection and management of municipal waste from inhabited properties according to the implementation schedule, 2) Collection and management of waste from PSZOK in Koluszki, 3) Preparing monthly reports to monitor the services provided and inform the Ordering Party about any: problems and irregularities noticed during the provision of municipal waste collection services, 4) Preparing and submitting annual reports to the Ordering Party in accordance with Chapter 4b of the Act of September 13, 1996 on maintaining cleanliness and order in municipalities (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1469). Place of implementation: the entire area of ​​the Koluszki Commune the following towns: Koluszki, Będzelin, Borowa, Długie, Erazmów, Felicjanów, Gałków Duży, Gałków Mały, Gałkówek Parcela, Jeziorko, Kazdrowien, Katarzynów, Kazimierzów, Koluszki, Leosin, Lisowice, Now.... Description of the subject of the order along with a description of the minimum parameters and technical requirements and functionalities are included in Annex No. 7 to the SWZ. The order is awarded as part of the Cybersecurity Local Government grant project number FERC.02.02-CS.01-001/23 under the European Funds for Digital Development Program (FERC), Priority II Advanced digital services, Measure 2.2. Strengthening the national cybersecurity system, title of the project Cybersecure local government in the Chemiec Commune, contract no. FERC.02.02-CS.01-001/23/1305/FERC.02.02-CS.01-001/23/2024 of July 18, 2024. Terms of contract execution included were included in the draft provisions of the public procurement contract, which constitutes Annex No. 6 to the SWZ.
